newsitem.title: NORWAY: SOCCER-JUVENTUS HELD TO DRAW IN NORWAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS HELD TO DRAW IN NORWAY.

text.p: Holders Juventus were held to a 1-1 draw by the Norwegian part-timers of Rosenborg in their European Cup quarter-final first leg on Wednesday.

The Italian league leaders, badly hit by injuries and looking sluggish in the freezing Norwegian night, were unable to put on a convincing performance as they struggled with a physically powerful Rosenborg who continue to surprise in this year's competition.
Rosenborg took a deserved lead six minutes into the second half when striker Trond Egil Soltvedt hooked the ball home after a goalmouth melee.

But as the capacity Norwegian crowd celebrated, the makeshift attacking pairing of Michele Padovani and Christian Vieri combined and Vieri nodded home a simple header to equalise and give Juventus an invaluable away goal for the second leg in two weeks' time.

Rosenborg, who dramatically tipped AC Milan out of the cup in the Champions' League phase, were far from over-awed by the Italians, who will be cautiously optimistic of qualifying in Italy when star strikers Alessandro Del Piero and Croat Alan Boksic may be fit.
